Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Olive Garden is going out of business and closing down in 2020, when in fact only two locations closed during that time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided in the expert's verdict, which states that Olive Garden faced financial hardship during the COVID-19 pandemic, leading to the closure of dine-in services and lost jobs.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Olive Garden did not go out of business in 2020.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that the closure of two Olive Garden locations signifies the entire chain going out of business, which is a problematic assumption.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the restaurant industry, which led to closures and financial losses for many establishments, including Olive Garden.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing accurate information about Olive Garden's closure and financial situation in 2020.
